text:
Great japanese language school for folks who prefer a slower pace. Minna no Nihongo is used for the beginner classes, which imo is a pretty solid choice because it uses kanji right from the start (even kanji beyond n5/n4 levels) - as someone with a rudimentary grasp of hanzi, it's a lot easier to remember kanji+hiragana/yomikata over pure hiragana/yomikata.

Teachers seem to be uniformly nice and approachable as well, and it's easy to switch between classes if you aren't meshing well with a particular teacher's teaching style. TLDR: Highly recommended :)
Teachers are great, management is absolutely abysmal
